That's interesting Ken. 

I'm keen to see how your networks will perform using competitive
coevolution.

-----Original Message-----
From: Kenneth Stanley [mailto:kstanley@...] 
Sent: 24 March 2004 23:58
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [neat] Roving Eye Paper

I know a number of people in this group are interested in using NEAT
for playing board games.  Here is a link to our new paper on evolving
a roving eye for Go:

http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/keyword?stanley:gecco04

This paper discusses an "eye" that is the same size no matter what
size
the Go board is.  The eye moves around at will and finally decides
where to place a piece.  The nice thing about this representation is
it can scale, while keeping its learned knowledge, from smaller to
larger boards.

Darren Izzard, check out the Acknowledgments section.  I put you in
there since you contributed to getting me thinking along these lines
with your roving eye work (which is currently available in this group
through the files section).

ken
